Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to fees charged by third-party food delivery services while an emergency has been declared and food service establishments are prohibited from operating at the maximum indoor occupancy, and for 90 days thereafter
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Fees charged by third-party food delivery services while an emergency has been declared and food service establishments are prohibited from operating at the maximum indoor occupancy, and for 90 days thereafter.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to telephone order charges by third-party food delivery services while a state of emergency has been declared and food service establishments are prohibited from operating at maximum indoor occupancy and for 90 days thereafter
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Telephone order charges by third-party food delivery services while a state of emergency has been declared and food service establishments are prohibited from operating at maximum indoor occupancy and for 90 days thereafter.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to reporting on financial assistance received by small businesses impacted by COVID-19
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Reporting on financial assistance received by small businesses impacted by COVID-19.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Speaker Johnson, Moya, Richards and Powers.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to reporting on financial assistance received by small businesses impacted by COVID-19
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Reporting on financial assistance received by small businesses impacted by COVID-19.
